Method Detail

makeUniqueStringForGlobal

public java.lang.String makeUniqueStringForGlobal(java.lang.String global)
Used to create a unique string for specified global. Unique string is a 5 digit unique number. Usage: 
 | make unique string for global | myGlobal |

Parameters:
global - - variable to store generated unique string within
Returns:

makeUniqueStringForGlobalWithLength

public java.lang.String makeUniqueStringForGlobalWithLength(java.lang.String global,
                                                            int length)
Used to create a unique string of a specified length for specified global. Usage: 
 | make unique string for global | myGlobal | with length | 9 |

Parameters:
global - - variable to store generated unique string within
length - - final length of generated string
Returns:

makeUniqueParagraphWithWordsForGlobal

public void makeUniqueParagraphWithWordsForGlobal(int words,
                                                  java.lang.String global)
Used to create a paragraph of unique words with varying lengths. Useful when you need to generate a unique string of words, Usage: 
 | make unique paragraph with | 15 | words for global | myGlobal |

Parameters:
words - - an intenger value of how many words to include in paragraph
global - - variable to store generated paragraph within.

storeStringInGlobal

public void storeStringInGlobal(java.lang.String toStore,
                                java.lang.String global)
Used to store a string inside of a global. Useful when you will be reusing the same string an unknown number of times and to increase managability of tests. specified string is parsed and can include previously defined globals. Usage: 
 | store string | this is my string | in global | myGlobal |

Parameters:
toStore - - String to store in global (parsed)
global - - variable to store parsed string within.

storeTokenOfStringInGlobal

public void storeTokenOfStringInGlobal(int token,
                                       java.lang.String string,
                                       java.lang.String global)
Used to store a specified single word from a string in a global. Useful if you know you will get a certain string and you need only one word from that string for use in later tests. Specified string can include previously defined globals. Usage: 
 | store token | 3 | of string | #[myGlobal] | in global | myGlobal |

Parameters:
token - - integer value of word in string, starting with 1 for first word
string - - string that contains wanted word
global - - variable to store word within.

printGlobal

public void printGlobal(java.lang.String global)
Used to print the contents of a global to the test output. Usage: 
 | print global | myGlobal |

Parameters:
global - - variable whose contents to print to the FitNesse error page

trimCharactersFromBeginningOfGlobal

public void trimCharactersFromBeginningOfGlobal(int characters,
                                                java.lang.String global)
Used to trim a specified number of characters from the beginning of the global. Useful if the data you need within global doesn't start at the beginning of a word (i.e. an invoice number that is formatted #12345, you need 12345 for later tests). Can be used singular or plural. Usage: 
 | trim | 1 | character from the beginning of global  | myGlobal |
 | trim | 3 | characters from the beginning of global | myGlobal |

Parameters:
characters - - integer number of characters to trim
global - - global to trim. trimmed string is saved in same global

trimCharacterFromBeginningOfGlobal

public void trimCharacterFromBeginningOfGlobal(int characters,
                                               java.lang.String global)

trimCharactersFromEndOfGlobal

public void trimCharactersFromEndOfGlobal(int characters,
                                          java.lang.String global)
Used to trim a specified number of characters from the end of the global. Useful if the data you need within global doesn't end at the end of a word (i.e. an invoice number that is formatted 12345-PLAY, you need 12345 for later tests). Can be used singular or plural. Usage: 
 | trim | 1 | character from the end of global | myGlobal |
 | trim | 5 | characters from the end of global | myGlobal |

Parameters:
characters - - integer number of characters to trim
global - - global to trim. Trimmed string is saved in same global

trimCharacterFromEndOfGlobal

public void trimCharacterFromEndOfGlobal(int characters,
                                         java.lang.String global)

concatenateWithAndStoreInGlobal

public void concatenateWithAndStoreInGlobal(java.lang.String c1,
                                            java.lang.String c2,
                                            java.lang.String global)
Used to concatenate two strings together and store the resulting string in a specified global. Note: there is no space between string 1 and string 2 in the final string. Strings are parsed for globals before they are concatenated. Usage: 
 | concatenate | this string | with | that string | and store in global | myGlobal |
This example results in the final string being "this stringthat string" (less quotes)

Parameters:
c1 - - first string
c2 - - second string - will be tacked onto the end of the first string
global - - global in which concatenated string will be stored.

concatenateWithAndStoreInGlobalWithSpace

public void concatenateWithAndStoreInGlobalWithSpace(java.lang.String c1,
                                                     java.lang.String c2,
                                                     java.lang.String global)
Used to concatenate two strings together and store the resulting string in a specified global. Note: there is a space between string 1 and string 2 in the final string. Strings are parsed for globals before they are concatenated. Usage: 
 | concatenate | this string | with | that string | and store in global | myGlobal | with space |
This example results in the final string being "this string that string" (less quotes)

Parameters:
c1 - - first string
c2 - - second string - will be tacked onto the end of the first string
global - - global in which concatenated string will be stored.

storeStringLengthInGlobal

public void storeStringLengthInGlobal(java.lang.String toGet,
                                      java.lang.String global)
Used to store the length of a string in a global. Useful for measuring strings to know if it's length is expected. String is parsed for globals before processing. Usage: 
 | store string | this string | length in glonal | myGlobal |

Parameters:
toGet - - the string to get the length of
global - - global to store the length of specified within.

compareWith

public boolean compareWith(java.lang.String c1,
                           java.lang.String c2)
Used to compare the values of two strings. The comparison is both done within the test, and printed to the FitNesse error log. Strings are parsed for globals. Usage: 
 | compare | this string | with | this string |

Parameters:
c1 - - String one
c2 - - String two

removeFromGlobal

public void removeFromGlobal(java.lang.String character,
                             java.lang.String global)
Used to remove a character or string of characters from an already stored global. Useful if your test captures a string (i.e. an account number), but the data you need is a substring of that string. Usage: 
 | remove | Account# | from global | myGlobal |

Parameters:
character - - string of characters to remove from the global
global - - global to remove characters from.

addPrefixToGlobal

public void addPrefixToGlobal(java.lang.String prefix,
                              java.lang.String global)
Used to add a string to the beginning of a stored global. Usage: 
 | add prefix | acct# | to global | myGlobal |

Parameters:
prefix - - String of characters to add to the global
global - - global to add characters to

addSuffixToGlobal

public void addSuffixToGlobal(java.lang.String suffix,
                              java.lang.String global)
Used to add a suffix to the end of a stored global. Usage: 
 | add suffix | lastname | to global | myGlobal |

Parameters:
suffix - - String of characters to add to the global
global - - global to add characters to
